channel.title: Easier way to code NPCs?
channel.description: I was wondering if there was an easier way to code NPCs other that typing line after line in autospawn. Perhaps a command like (::placenpc 324) that would add the npc permanently to the game and also put it in the Autospawn folder. Thanks for any help.

item.title: Easier way to code NPCs?
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

[quote=“zeke, post:3, topic:365028”]Found it…

if(command.startsWith(“spawn”) && playerRights > 2){
int npcid = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6));
int absx = absX;
int absy = absY;
appendToAutoSpawn2(npcid, absx, absy, absX + 4, absY + 4, absX -4, absY - 4);
sM(“Npc added.”);
}

This code takes the coords of where you are currently standing, and plugs them into another .txt document then you can copy and paste into Autospawn.cfg[/quote]Hope this works for you. It never would go right with mine so I had to re-edit it.

Read full topic

item.title: Easier way to code NPCs?
item.dc:creator: @zeke zeke
item.description:
@zeke wrote:

Found it…

if(command.startsWith(“spawn”) && playerRights > 2){
int npcid = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6));
int absx = absX;
int absy = absY;
appendToAutoSpawn2(npcid, absx, absy, absX + 4, absY + 4, absX -4, absY - 4);
sM(“Npc added.”);
}

This code takes the coords of where you are currently standing, and plugs them into another .txt document then you can copy and paste into Autospawn.cfg

item.title: Easier way to code NPCs?
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

I hate to break it to you, but unless you make the command yourself (like tell it what to place in the autospawn.cfg) then you will have to place it in the file yourself. If you need anything else just pm me.

Read full topic
